HvorMyeForside.Title: How much can I get in parental benefits?
HvorMyeForside.Innhold: This guide is for those who want to know approximately how much parental benefits you can get from NAV.
HvaSkjerNårForside.Title: What happens when?
HvaSkjerNårForside.Innhold: This guide is for those who want to learn more about what happens from applying for parental benefits to the money being fully paid out.
FpEllerEsForside.Title: Parental benefits or one-time grant?
FpEllerEsForside.Innhold: This guide is for those who want to know if they are entitled to parental benefits and/or a one-time grant.
Tittel: How much can I get in parental benefits?
ArbeidssituasjonSide.Arbeidssituasjon: What is your current work situation?
ArbeidssituasjonSide.Forskjellen: What is the difference between a freelancer and self-employed?
ArbeidssituasjonSide.TreSisteMåneder: How much did you earn in the last 3 months?
ArbeidssituasjonSide.GirRett: Which payments entitle you to parental benefits?
ArbeidssituasjonSide.EnAvDisse: If you receive one of these payments from NAV, you may be entitled to parental allowance:
ArbeidssituasjonSide.UtbetaltTreSiste: How much did you receive in the last 3 months before tax?
ArbeidssituasjonSide.LønnOgUtbetaling: Include both salary and payments from NAV
ArbeidssituasjonSide.SNKanIkkeBruke: As a self-employed person, you cannot use this guide at the moment.
ArbeidssituasjonSide.Lenke: how much you can get as a self-employed person
ArbeidssituasjonSide.OmsorgOgPleie: Care, nursing or training allowance for a sick child
OppsummeringSide.GjennomsnittligUtbetali: Average payment with {erDekningsgrad100, select, true {100} other {80}}% parental benefits for {antallUker} weeks
OppsummeringSide.Totalt: Total for {erDekningsgrad100, select, true {25} other {30}} weeks before tax
OppsummeringSide.AntallUkerInfo: If the parental benefit period is equally shared between both parents, it will be around {erDekningsgrad100, select, true {25} other {30}} weeks. This is used as an indication of how much you can get in total parental benefits, although you may receive more or less than this.
OppsummeringSide.UtbetaltSomVanlig: Many receive their salary as usual from their employer during the leave
OppsummeringSide.ArbeidsgiverFraNav: If this is the case, your employer will receive parental benefits from NAV and you will receive your salary as normal. You need to contact your employer to learn more about this.
OppsummeringSide.EsSkalBidra: A one-time grant is meant to help cover some of the expenses associated with having a child. The grant is a lump sum of {engangsstønad} kroner.
OppsummeringSide.SammenlignFpOgEs: You may want to compare parental benefit and lump sum benefit
OppsummeringSide.SammenlignFpOgEsInfoPar: With the income you have stated, you will be entitled to parental benefit. It may still be worthwhile in your situation to choose a one-off benefit. One-off benefit is a payment you receive once {engangsstønad}.
to see the advantages and disadvantages of choosing one-off benefit or parental benefit.
HøyInntektInfobox.DelvisDekning: You are covered up to {maxÅrslønn} of your income
HøyInntektInfobox.OppgittHøyereInntekt: You have reported an income higher than this, but this is not covered by NAV.
HøyInntektInfobox.HøyereLenke2: the basic amount in the National Insurance Scheme.
HarIkkeRettTilFpInfobox.IkkeRett: With an annual income below {minÅrslønn}, you are not entitled to parental benefits
HarIkkeRettTilFpInfobox.AntattLønn: Based on what you have reported, we assume you have an annual income of {antattÅrslønn} per year. To be entitled to parental benefits, you must earn at least {minÅrslønn} per year.
HarIkkeRettTilFpInfobox.Lenke1: You may be entitled to a one-time grant instead. You can use
HarIkkeRettTilFpInfobox.Lenke2: NAV's guide for one-time grant or parental benefits
HvorMyeForside.UsikkerFp: Unsure if you are entitled to parental benefits?
HvorMyeForside.PrøvVeiviser: Try our guide “Parental benefits or one-time grant?”.
